alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 17 at 6:38PM MDT until April 19 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT LATE TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR ALL AREAS EXCEPT THE SOUTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Westerly winds will strengthen once again on Tuesday as exceptionally dry conditions persist. Along with an unstable atmosphere and well above normal temperatures, this will lead to widespread critical fire weather conditions. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands and Sandia, Manzano, and Gallinas Mountains Tuesday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...8 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Highlands; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains
